newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Soporcel unaware any delay to new machine.
newsitem.headline: Soporcel unaware any delay to new machine.

text.p: Portuguese paper group Soporcel-Sociedade Portuguesa de Papel expects a government study on the pulp and paper sector to be ready by end-year and is pressing ahead with plans for a second paper machine, the company's chairman said on Thursday.
Alvaro Barreto told Reuters that the 63-billion escudo ($413 million) investment programme in the new capacity had not be delayed.

He had been asked to comment on a report in the Publico newspaper that the government's study of a restructuring of the sector was several months behind schedule. The paper said this meant the Soporcel investment was also being pushed back.
The government survey covers state-controlled Portucel Industrial along with Inapa-Investimentos, Participacoes & Gestao and Soporcel.
"Our planning is based on the information given to us by the Economy Minister, some two weeks ago, that the (government) survey would be ready by the end of the year," Barreto said.
Officials at the Economy Ministry could not be immediately contacted to comment.
Barreto said negotiations on the financing of the second machine in its Figueira da Foz installations were going ahead.
The new machine is due to come on stream in June 1998.

According to Publico, the government had contacted four international banks -- Goldman Sachs, Union Bank of Switzerland, Banco Santander de Negocios & Deutsche Morgan Grenfell-- for the study on the re-organisation of the pulp and paper sector.
